definition: to shift (funds)/to (legitimately) take funds set aside for one purpose in order to use them for another/to embezzle/to misappropriate
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: The minister was found to have appropriated government money.
The fund earmarked for capital construction is not to be diverted to any other purpose.
sentences.chinese: 不得挪用基本建設資金。

sentences.english: The problem is not simply one of embezzlement and bribery.
sentences.chinese: 問題不僅僅是挪用公款和貪污受賄那麼簡單。

sentences.english: First section, the abject and target violated by crime of embezzle public funds.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分，關於挪用公款罪侵犯的客體和犯罪對象。

sentences.english: The accountant knocked down plenty of money without being caught.
sentences.chinese: 那個會計挪用了大筆錢而未被發現。

sentences.english: The crime of embezzling funds is newly added to the Penal Code in 1997.
sentences.chinese: 1997年刑法新增加了挪用資金罪的罪名。
他們貪污挪用公款使商行破產了。

sentences.english: No unit or individual may divert the forest vegetation recovery fees for other purposes.
sentences.chinese: 任何單位和個人不得挪用森林植被恢復費。

sentences.english: Overloading expense accounts or diverting advances to personal use.
sentences.chinese: 虛增費用或者挪用預付款用於私人用途。

sentences.english: Many companies have gone broke because of theft or embezzlement.
sentences.chinese: 許多公司因爲盜竊或挪用公款而破產。

sentences.english: Kong diverts the company large amount fund to it the delinquent account to confess fully.
sentences.chinese: 孔某對其挪用公司鉅額資金的犯罪事實供認不諱。

sentences.english: Ex-Taiwan leader Lee indicted on graft charge.
sentences.chinese: 臺灣前領導人李登輝涉嫌挪用公款被起訴。

sentences.english: It is illegal for a fiduciary to misappropriate money for personal gain.
sentences.chinese: 受託人爲了個人利益挪用金錢是不合法的。

sentences.english: The treasurer was arrested for appropriating company funds.
sentences.chinese: 該出納由於挪用公司資金而被捕。

sentences.english: Misappropriating public funds for the use of private company does not belong to for the use of person.
sentences.chinese: 挪用公款給私有公司企業使用不屬於歸個人使用。

definition: to embezzle by adding to the payroll employees existing in name only
in arrears/behind in payments/to default on one's debts
special fund/money allocated for a particular purpose
